book.title: The Big Short: Inside the Doomsday Machine

review.body: Really entertaining account of the 2008 meltdown. Wall Street makes me sad.

"Passenger 19" by Ward Larsen was a pretty darn good yarn. I'm not usually a "plane down, go rescue" kind of girl, I tend to choose the more traditional mysteries. But this was a very tightly written mystery that had me wondering how the hero was going to win the day.

Jammer Davis has been a pilot...

book.title: Cars and Trucks and Things That Go

review.body:
This is currently Sawyer's (2.5) favorite book. He will read it while practicing sitting on the toilet. He pours over it looking for Goldbug on each page and when he and Daddy read it together they have fun trying to find Goldbug before the other does.

It's a long book so usually we just read a f...
simply awesome!

book.title: The Foot Book: Dr. Seuss's Whacky Book of Opposites (Bright and Early Board Books)
book.publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers

review.body: this book is so quickly to read I get done fast
A nice hilarious and refreshing read.

A book for keepsakes... read it time and again...
One of the best i have ever read

book.title: Locked In: One Girl's Explosive True Story of Child Abuse

review.body:
Ok book

That was the shortest book I believe I have ever read. I was sitting down thinking this was going to be a long book, I had the whole thing done in less than an hour. Really glad I didn't buy this book!

خواطر كتبها خلسة في سجنه الذي قضى به خمس سنوات ، عصارة فكر وخبرة للحياة ، اطلاع واسع وعميق في مختلف المجالات الدينية والفلسفية والفكرية والتاريخية .
في هذا الكتاب ستجد مزيجا من كل شيء ، يقطف لك المفكر الاسلامي علي عزت بيجوفيتش من كل بستان زهرة مما يجذبني للقراءة فيه بذهن صافٍ وتركيز عميق لما فيه...

4.5 stars
"Golden” by Kathryn Robson was one of the most unexpectedly awesome books I’ve read in a looong time. To be totally honest, at first I wasn’t sure I’d like it because I had a hard time figuring out what it was about from the description, and I’ve been a bit burned out on paranormal latel...

book.title: Watson's Dictionary of Weasel Words, Contemporary Cliches, Cant & Manage

review.body:
Written in 2004, Watson’s Dictionary of Weasel Words describes itself as “a serious weapon in the struggle against those whose words kill brain cells and sink hearts”. For those who know me even just a little, it should come as no great surprise that I was drawn to this book.

So what are “weasel w...

"The world's a hard fucking place…A little hard to get by with just please."


Reading this book was like being the middle of a high action Western! Horrible things happened and I loved it. The blurb pretty much covers it all, so I’ll just stick with telling how much I enjoyed this book.

I loved...
just can't wait for the next one. getting better with each book.
A masterpiece of tragicomedy!
Very good.

Loved this book!

Great, fast read. Adventure at every turn. Lots of twists and turns. I thoroughly enjoyed this book! Mystery thriller that keeps your heartbeat up!!

Arik feels that his days as an artist on the rise are over now that he’s suffered horrible burns to his dominant left hand. Unaware of the damage to his hand culminating in the apparent end of his burgeoning career, one of his idols, Ken Brighton, extends an invitation to collaborate on a project...

Maximum Exposure

Unexpectedly good plot and character development. I liked the storyline and the way it unfolded. Looking forward to the next book.

Couldn't Put It Down

IOU was a well crafted story that kept me wanting to read on. Len's style was engaging from the very first sentence. One of those stories that stays with you. Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great read with no slow spots.

this book was amazing! One of my favorite books of the year so far. The writing was beautiful and thoughtfull. I was smiling like an idiot while reading this book. Henry Denton is such a deep charcter. His struggles with family and just life are relatable and inspiring. I highly recommend!
